bibl.title: James McGarth and William Herbert v. King County. Testimony of McGarth.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

keywords.term: F.W. Wunthoff Will Robinson James Ludlow Ronnell Sentigo

div1.ab: United States of America Territory of Washington County of King SS
div1.p: James McGarth on oath says that on or about the 187th day of March 1880 at Seattle in said county James McGarth and William Herbert were guilty of passing counterfit coin of the United States, knowing the same to be counterfit with intent to defraud the people contrary to the statutes of the United States in such case made and provided.
div1.ab: Subscribed and sworn before me this 17th day of March 1880
United States vs James McGarth + William Herbert Complaint Filed May 17th 1880 Ronnell Sentigo Filed March 22nd 1880 James Seavge, Clerk. By James P. Ludlow Deputy Clerk. Will Robinson F.W. Wunthoff
